result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy T. Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not drive w/o license.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpd court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Kristy W or her residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

15CF1176/16CF401
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Jodi L Meier appears on behalf of Defendant in 15CF1176 and Atty Bates appears on behalf of Defendant in 16CF401.  Defendant does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Meier states she received a message from DE stating he was out of town and couldn't get a ride to court today.  Atty Meier moves to withdraw as counsel at this time and motion is granted.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond in each file, but will stay warrant until 7/15/16 at which time bond will be forfeited if not voluntary appearance is requested.  Atty Bates is willing to accept 15CF1176 should PD's Office choose to appoint him.
filed by Atty Meier

Atty Meier states case is not resolved at this time as they are still trying to reach a global offer.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 10:50 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
filed by Atty Meier

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jeremy T. Lawrence, appeared with Attorney Jodi L Meier.  Clerk: PT
Atty Meier moves to withdraw as counsel as case is not yet resolved and per instructions of the PD's Office.  DE does not want Atty Meier to withdraw.  Upon hearing statements motion to withdraw is denied and Atty Meier shall continue as counsel.  Atty Meier requests an adjournment as DE has new charges; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jodi Meier.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At the request of both parties, FPT adj. to 4/15/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
